abstract: Former New York Mets pitcher Jesse Orosco is most remembered for launching his glove into air after striking out Boston Red Sox second baseman Marty Barrett for final out in Game 7 of 1986 World Series; Mets unexpected return to World Series this year has rekindled attention on 1986 team, especially Orosco.
lead_paragraph: The most indelible moment of Orosco’s career centers not on a ball that he threw but on a glove — the one he launched high into the air after striking out Boston’s Marty Barrett for the final out of Game 7 of the 1986 World Series.

headline.main: Jesse Orosco’s Pitching Career Is Defined by a Joyous Toss of a Glove
headline.print_headline: A Life of Pitching, Defined by a Joyous Toss of a Glove

snippet: The most indelible moment of Orosco’s career centers not on a ball that he threw but on a glove — the one he launched high into the air after striking out Boston’s Marty Barrett for the final out of Game 7 of the 1986 World Series.
